freenet.client.async
Class ClientGetter

java.lang.Object
  freenet.client.async.ClientRequester
      freenet.client.async.BaseClientGetter
          freenet.client.async.ClientGetter
All Implemented Interfaces:
GetCompletionCallback
public class ClientGetter
extends BaseClientGetter

A high level data request. Follows redirects, downloads splitfiles, etc. Similar to what you get from FCP, and is used internally to implement FCP. Also used by fproxy, and plugins, and so on. The current state of the request is stored in currentState. The ClientGetState's do most of the work. SingleFileFetcher for example fetches a key, parses the metadata, and if necessary creates other states to e.g. fetch splitfiles.

ClientGetter

public ClientGetter(ClientGetCallback client,
                    FreenetURI uri,
                    FetchContext ctx,
                    short priorityClass,
                    RequestClient clientContext,
                    Bucket returnBucket,
                    Bucket binaryBlobBucket)
Fetch a key.

Parameters:
client - The callback we will call when it is completed.
uri - The URI to fetch.
ctx - The config settings for the fetch.
priorityClass - The priority at which to schedule the request.
clientContext - The context object. Used for round-robin query balancing, also indicates whether the request is persistent.
returnBucket - The bucket to return the data in. Can be null. If not null, the ClientGetter must either write the data directly to the bucket, or copy it and free the original temporary bucket. Preferably the former, obviously!
binaryBlobBucket - If non-null, we will write all the keys accessed (or that could have been accessed in the case of redundant structures such as splitfiles) in the binary blob format to this bucket.
Method Detail

start

public void start(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                  ClientContext context)
           throws FetchException
Throws:
FetchException

start

public boolean start(boolean restart,
                     FreenetURI overrideURI,
                     com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                     ClientContext context)
              throws FetchException
Start the request.

Parameters:
restart - If true, restart a finished request.
overrideURI - If non-null, change the URI we are fetching (usually when restarting).
container - The database, null if this is a non-persistent request; if this is a persistent request, we must be on the database thread, and we will pass the database handle around as needed.
context - The client context, contains important mostly non-persistent global objects.
Returns:
True if we restarted, false if we didn't (but only in a few cases).
Throws:
FetchException - If we were unable to restart.

onSuccess

public void onSuccess(FetchResult result,
                      ClientGetState state,
                      com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                      ClientContext context)
Called when the request succeeds.

Parameters:
result - The final data.
state - The ClientGetState which retrieved the data.

onFailure

public void onFailure(FetchException e,
                      ClientGetState state,
                      com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                      ClientContext context)
Called when the request fails. Retrying will have already been attempted by the calling state, if appropriate; we have tried to get the data, and given up.

Parameters:
e - The reason for failure, in the form of a FetchException.
state - The failing state.

cancel

public void cancel(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                   ClientContext context)
Cancel the request. This must result in onFailure() being called in order to send the client a cancel FetchException, and to removeFrom() the state.

Specified by:
cancel in class ClientRequester
Parameters:
container - The database. Must be non-null if the request or insert is persistent, in which case we must be on the database thread.
context - The ClientContext object including essential but non-persistent objects such as the schedulers.

innerToNetwork

protected void innerToNetwork(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                              ClientContext context)
Notify clients that some part of the request has been sent to the network i.e. we have finished checking the datastore for at least some part of the request. Sent once only for any given request.

Specified by:
innerToNetwork in class ClientRequester

onBlockSetFinished

public void onBlockSetFinished(ClientGetState state,
                               com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                               ClientContext context)
Called when no more blocks will be added to the total, and therefore we can confidently display a percentage for the overall progress. Will notify clients with a SplitfileProgressEvent.

onTransition

public void onTransition(ClientGetState oldState,
                         ClientGetState newState,
                         com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
Called when the current state creates a new state and we switch to that. For example, a SingleFileFetcher might switch to a SplitFileFetcher. Sometimes this will be called with oldState not equal to our currentState; this means that a subsidiary request has changed state, so we ignore it.

Specified by:
onTransition in interface GetCompletionCallback
Specified by:
onTransition in class ClientRequester

public boolean canRestart()
Can the request be restarted?

restart

public boolean restart(FreenetURI redirect,
                       com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                       ClientContext context)
                throws FetchException
Restart the request.

Parameters:
redirect - Use this URI instead of the old one.
container - The database. We must be on the database thread! See ClientContext for convenience methods.
Returns:
True if we successfully restarted, false if we can't restart.
Throws:
FetchException - If something went wrong.

removeFrom

public void removeFrom(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                       ClientContext context)
Remove the ClientGetter from the database. You must call this on the database thread, and it must be a persistent request. We do not remove anything we are not responsible for.

Overrides:
removeFrom in class ClientRequester
